physDesc.p: There are some corrections in this homily that appear to be by the main scribe, though using a slightly thinner pen and lighter ink.

handNote.p: Main scribe of pp. 99-208 and pp. 225-354 of this manuscript, including this homily. Rotund hand. e varies between round and horned, so does c. The main hand has a quirk in which ascenders of long, tall letters, especially þ, tend to wobble slightly, curving a bit left at the top and curving to the right at the bottom. This hand is identifiable with the main scribe of Cambridge, Corpus Christi College 419 (ECHOE handID DP0423).
